page.title: 12BRIGHTON MARINA TODAY
page.content: The 50 hectare site of the Marina is enclosed by 2 breakwaters, and is sufficient for 2,000 boats. After the seabed had been dredged, 110 caissons using 1000 tonnes of concrete, were emplaced to form the breakwaters. An outer tidal harbour is separated from an inner, non-tidal harbour by a causeway. A lock provides the connection between outer and inner harbours, the largest non-industrial lock in Europe. The first berths were available in l977. The Marina was opened to the public in l978 and the completed harbours were opened by the Queen on 3l May l979. For a short time a hydrofoil conveyed passengers to Dieppe but its profitability was marred by frequent blockades by French fishermen.Today tourists are attracted by an annual boat show and an ex-Royal Navy ship on permanent public display.
